titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Bill Landis, 1997

did.abstract: Volume first used for poetry and notes by an unidentified Civil War soldier, then either sold or given to Hoyt's father, who used it briefly for farm accounts. It was then taken up by Anna Hoyt and used for poetry, arithmetic calculations, and various notes and sketches.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The memorandum book (Donor No. 3127) was donated by E. Beryl Bishop of Lapeer, Michigan, in 1961.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright to the collection has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan

custodhist.p: In a letter accompanying this item, the donor stated that "the little account book I recently found in an antique shop in Holt. The dealer didn't know where it came from." What little is known about the creators comes from information internal to the memorandum book itself.

prefercite.p: Anna Hoyt Memorandum Book, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Anna Hoyt was a resident of Mount Morris, Michigan.

scopecontent.p: Volume first used for poetry and notes by an unidentified Civil War soldier, then either sold or given to Hoyt's father, who used it briefly for farm accounts. It was then taken up by Anna Hoyt and used for poetry, arithmetic calculations, and various notes and sketches.
